alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:12PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Natrona County through 645 PM MDT... At 611 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Hiland, which is also 42 miles east of Shoshoni, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Natrona County, including the following locations... Arminto. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for central Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains
